intro: Corunastylis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved corunastylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understoreys. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Corunastylis parvifolia is a perennial herb that is often found in the eastern and southern regions of Australia.
